entry.title: Add UKM metrics for user reloads as 3PC breakage indicator.
entry.content:
This CL adds a new UKM collection for third-party cookie breakage

indicators, which are events that we suspect to possibly occur in

greater quantity on sites which the user perceives as breaking.



The initial measurement is recording user-initiated reloads.



UKM collection review at

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1l8eQGT6mfzxgbc1fzIb0r7MGjH3OV-dcuG7LtD7Ol7g/edit

entry.content:
This change updates the function used to determine whether a Bluetooth

device should be filtered from the UI to check whether the device has

any of the UUIDs associated with Nearby Share or Phone Hub, and

explicitly filter them.

entry.title: Improve PersonalDataManager waiting in unit tests.
entry.content:
PersonalDataManager operations that interact with the WebDatabase are

asynchronous. Unit test work around that by observing the

PersonalDataManager and waiting for OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks()

to trigger. However, right now these EXPECT_CALLs are all set on

PersonalDataManagerTestBase::personal_data_observer_.



According to the gMock documentation [1]:

> gMock requires expectations to be set before the mock functions are

> called, otherwise the behavior is undefined. Do not alternate between

> calls to EXPECT_CALL() and calls to the mock functions



By only using a single observer, unit tests trigger this undefined

behavior at the moment (though tests still pass).



This is fixed by introducing a dedicated PersonalDataProfileTaskWaiter

class, which waits for OnPersonalDataFinishedProfileTasks() and and can

be used to set additional expectations.

The allows removing the existing zoo of waiting functions.



Most of this delta comes from replacing WaitForOnPersonalDataChanged()

with PersonalDataProfileTaskWaiter(*personal_data_).Wait().



Finally, this new waiting mechanism allows fixing a TODO in the

ServerCardsShowInTransportMode test, by setting the expectations

correctly. See this discussion [2].



[1] https://g3doc.corp.google.com/third_party/googletest/g3doc/gmock_for_dummies.md?cl=head#using-mocks-in-tests

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4660713/comment/a925145b_2f6c85bb/



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: I54edb07193f3c6f5f08bd5175869e0a1aa0e8c9d

entry.title: [cc/tiles] Add a feature to bypass the image decode cache, use it in PDF
entry.content:
When an image is added to the GpuImageDecodeCache, it is never removed

until the cache is cleared or it runs out of capactity. The capacity is

set on the renderer side to 2000 images by default. Howver, the actual

caching happens in the GPU process, in the service transfer cache (for

the most common path). There, the capacity is set to 256MiB on most

desktop machines, and 128MiB on Android. So overall, once an image is

added to the decode cache, it is not removed until memory usage reaches

256MiB on desktop.



However, for PDF rendering, a brand new image is produced by the plugin

at each frame, and never re-used. This means that at 1080p, each frame

adds ~8MiB into the cache, filling it up after 32 frames.



Since we know that the images are never re-used, this CL addresses that

by setting a "no_cache" flag on the cc::PaintImage, which prevents

caching. Locally, this avoids a 256MiB memory spike when scrolling a

PDF. For more details, see the linked bug.



Change-Id: Ic27238784ed3fabbdf63a5f337e32735e5fe62e5

Bug: 1464610

entry.title: [Thumbnail Cache] Fix/remove DCHECKs and add fieldtrial entry
entry.content:
Fieldtrial entry is required to continue experiment rollout.



Also fix a couple of DCHECK violations that were hit in edgecases such as closing all tabs triggering a layout transition. These were covered in tests when updating the fieldtrial entry.



The following cases were fixed:



1) Referencing a static layer for a Tab which has been deleted.



Add an onTabUnregistered observer to set the TAB_ID for the StaticLayout

to INVALID_TAB_ID if the current tab is closed.



2) Continuing to push compositor frames referencing the TAB_ID after

another layout has taken over and updated the visible tab ids. In this

case the layout is no longer "active". If this occurs push an

INVALID_TAB_ID for any straggling updates.



3) There is a window of time after an activity restart or enters multi

window mode where a live layer may not be available yet. If a live layer

is requested, but doesn't draw we should Update the visible tab ids

before requesting a static layer.



Bug: 1459020

Change-Id: Ib6153b8f416ef84eef7e4b04c5f60be9b0604de0

entry.title: arc: Add dbc environment variable
entry.content:
This adds the ARCVM_DBC environment variable if the dbc USB debugging device /dev/ttyDBC0 has been created.

See: https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/v5.4/driver-api/usb/usb3-debug-port.html



This allows for adb over USB via dbc. The environment variable is processed by arcvm-adbd.



Bug: 121287022

Test: adb debugging over dbc works.

entry.title: [Omnibox] Reset visible hint for non LTR text
entry.content:
If a block of non LTR text crosses the end of the viewport, we

incorrectly capture the visible hint, which causes us to not screenshot

when we should.



This cl resets the visible hint in this case, so that we do take a

screenshot.

entry.title: Add Main Fragment implementation
entry.content:
* MainFragment is responsible for:

* Executing a HTTP request.

* Restarting CronetEngine with the currently configured options. In order for new changes to take effect, cronet engine must be restarted.

* Clear the text from the previous request. This is useful for hitting the same endpoint multiple time and checking the logs while wanting to make sure that the requests are successfully executed.

entry.title: Reland "[Inspector] Skip adding source data for non-existent implicit nested groups"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 31acf2db4c910a483631f29ed6556af02b93c6c5



Previous change was assuming that all the rules without header ranges that can have properties but doesn't have any properties to be an implicit nested group. However, `@font-face` is also such a rule: it doesn't have a header range and it might contain properties.



This change is updating the check to check for whether the candidate implicit group rule is a kStyle rule or not.



Original change's description:

> [Inspector] Skip adding source data for non-existent implicit nested groups

>

> See the bug for the reproduction and issue description.

>

> The crux of the issue lies in nested group rules[1] and how the parser notifies the observer when they encounter such rules.

>

> Take the CSS below as example:

> ```

> .foo {

> @supports(display: flex) {

> & {

> color: red;

> }

> }

> }

> ```

>

> While parsing the body of the `@supports` rule above, CSS parser notifies the observer that this might be the start of the implicit nested group with a zero length header range[2].

>

> However, if there are no properties for this implicit nested group, CSS parser doesn't register it so such a group doesn't exist for the rule list got from the parser[3].

>

> in this CL, to match the same behavior with the CSS parser while registering the source data, we check whether there are any properties parsed for this possible "implicit nested group".

>

> If not, we skip adding the rule itself and only take its child rules' data.

>

> [1]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting-1/#nested-group-rules

> [2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2122;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

> [3]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2131;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

>

> Fixed: 1445720

> Change-Id: Ifbd2e85873374929d0ceadf4fb5905eaf4ddd62b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4681759

> Reviewed-by: Changhao Han

> Commit-Queue: Changhao Han

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170208}



Change-Id: If0cf79a9cc932764091c3fdd6f6f523aad48a2bb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687466

Reviewed-by: Alex Rudenko

entry.title: Add Options Singleton
entry.content:
* Options will live in a singleton that can be accessed from anywhere in the app. Options are different from base flags, options are different modes in which Cronet can behave(ex: slow download, connection migration, ...). Each Option is associated with a value and an action.

* Action is an interface for which options can apply their changes to the Builders provided by the CronetEngine.

* Implemented only three different options for now: Connection migration, early session migration and simulation of slow download.

* Added ActionData which will hold all the necessary data an action might need to change, future builders can be added there to maintain compatibility.



Change-Id: I419c0ca1acbc8a802ed8f6164932c76bbbfa3a51

entry.title: Fix os settings PIN setup UMA logic
entry.content:
This commit fixes the bug that we don't record metrics during PIN setup

in the os-settings page.



The function `recordLockScreenProgress` records the relevant metric. UI

components were supposed to call this method indirectly via their

`writeUma_` (or similar) attributes to enable dependency injection for

testing. However, the `settings-setup-pin-dialog` element

default-initialized this attribute to a no-op function, and the

`settings-lock-screen-subpage` element instantiated the pin dialog

element without passing a `writeUma_` attribute. This meant that the

attribute was a no-op function, and consequently no metrics were

recorded.



This commit removes the dependency injection via `writeUma_`, which is

not needed anymore because the unit tests that required it were

rewritten into browser tests (e.g. `OSSettingsPinSetupTest`). The

`recordLockScreenProgress` functions is now called directly, which fixes

the bug.



Bug: b:270962495

from that directory.

entry.title: [code coverage] Do not explicitly write coverage data for iOS EG tests
entry.content:
Per LLVM doc[1], "%c" in configured profile path enables online syncing

of coverage data, so we don't need to call the write function. Also,

the resetting counter function call after the write function is likely

causing correctness problems.



[1] https://clang.llvm.org/docs/SourceBasedCodeCoverage.html#running-the-instrumented-program



Bug: 1452099

entry.title: Add the PromptForExternalNewsSchemes feature
entry.content:
This enabled-by-default feature changes the external protocol handling

to not treat news: and snews: schemes as default-allowed. If a handler

is present, the user will be prompted to open the application, as with

other arbitrary app schemes. With this feature enabled, only mailto:

remains default-allowed.

entry.title: Fix side panel toolbar container flashing border bug.
entry.content:
We were setting a pinned button from not highlighted to not highlighted

which can trigger the ink drop to reanimate. This causes GetHighlighted

to return true (which causes the border line to be seen) even if the ink

drop is not seen. Transitioning the ink drop from hidden to hidden does

not cause this issue so we instead do this. See comment in

InkDropImpl::AnimateToState for more context.

entry.title: Fire the navigate event on the correct document on RenderDocument's
entry.content:
LocalFrame<->LocalFrame swap



When RenderDocument is enabled, same-site cross-document navigations

will create a new LocalFrame instead of reusing the previous

LocalFrame. This means, when trying to run the navigate event on the

previous document during commit of the new document, we must reach

into the previous LocalFrame to get the correct document to fire the

event to, which this CL does.

entry.title: [ios] Fix DCHECK about invoking SetSelectedType() while sync-everything
entry.content:
The call was anyway redundant, not necessary because of how

SyncUserSettingsImpl::GetSelectedTypes() honors the sync-everything bit

upon read, independently of what the individual toggle/pref says.



In addition, SyncSetupService::SetSyncEverythingEnabled() also

effectively writes to the kPayments pref, because it internally uses

SyncUserSettings::SetSelectedTypes(), which updates all individual

prefs.

entry.content:
Add AshAttestationCleanupManager which inherits from

UserManager::Observer and implements OnUserRemoved to clean up the

device-wide certificate and keys which were created for the user as

part of the DTC flow. This will only happen on unmanaged devices due to

stricter privacy constraints for user account removals.

entry.title: Ensure the challenge exists when `TokenBindingHelper::SignAssertionToken` is invoked
entry.content:
`TokenBindingHelper::GenerateBindingKeyAssertion` takes as an argument a

`base::StringPiece` challenge. If the binding key hasn't been loaded,

the challenge will be accessed asynchronously. `base::StringPiece` is

like a pointer or a reference - it doesn't own the actual string. There

is no guarantee that the challenge outlives

`TokenBindingHelper::SignAssertionToken`. Therefore we will create a new

string in this particular case.

entry.title: [iOS][TrustedVault] Use TrustedVaultService in ios/chrome/browser
entry.content:
This CL aligns iOS implementation with desktop/Android one, following

that TrustedVault is now decoupled from Sync. In particular:

1. Makes use of TrustedVaultService, that owns TrustedVaultClient for

Sync and might be extended in the future to support other features.

2. Introduces ios/chrome/browser/trusted_vault and moves

IOSTrustedVaultClient there.

3. Adds iOS-specific keyed service factory for TrustedVault.



Bug: 1434661

entry.title: Fix crashes from races between auto and manual kiosk launch.
entry.content:
This crash happens from a check in extension subsystem when a different

session type is set. It can happen on slow devices during auto MGS or

kiosk launch when login screen shelf lags and is not disabled in time.

User can then launch a manual kiosk while another session setup is in

progress.

entry.title: [DBSC]: Create SessionBindingHelper
entry.content:
`SessionBindingHelper` loads the session binding key in memory and

provides an asynchronous method of creating a binding key assertion.

This class will be passed to each `BoundSessionRefreshCookieFetcherImpl`

and will be used to sign challenges on cookie rotation network requests

if needed.

entry.title: QuickStart: Change Gaia JSON request keys to camelCase
entry.content:
Gaia automatically translates between the JSON request/response sent

from/to ChromeOS and its internal proto representation.



Proto3 supports a canonical encoding to / from JSON -

https://protobuf.dev/programming-guides/proto3/#json - with camelCase

strings for JSON keys.



SecondDeviceAuthBroker currently uses snake_case. Change the keys to

camelCase.



Bug: b/259021973

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*SecondDeviceAuthBrokerTest*"

Change-Id: I5df334e6e3745a7db9b684c855ac56c1c393b57c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4684347

Commit-Queue: Kush Sinha

Reviewed-by: Renato Silva

entry.title: Inline constexpr variable definitions in headers.
entry.content:
Static constexpr variable definitions inside classes are automatically

"inline", meaning that all translation units refer to the same variable.



For constexpr variable definitions outside of classes, that is not true.

Every definition of the type

constexpr char kMyConstant = "....";

will receive its own copy in every file that includes this header. This

is unnecessary (and can even be error-prone).



This CL mechanically makes all constexpr variable definitions inside

components/password_manager headers inline.



Relevant links:

- https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/hmyGFD80ocE

- https://abseil.io/tips/168



Bug: n/a

Change-Id: Ib96a973ac108334f5c016099fc1cc2e9761879e6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4684177

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

entry.title: Spruce up getAllScreensMedia tests
entry.content:
In InteractionBetweenGetAllScreensMediaAndGetDisplayMediaTest:

* Parameterize the suite to reduce the number of tests and make it

easier for a reader to follow what the focus of tests are and how

individual tests in the suite differ from one another.

* Reduce the number of methods by parameterizing some of them to

accept the name of the variant on which they will operate.

* Clarify the difference between programmatically stopping and

simulating the user stopping through the browser UX.

* Remove busy-wait for user interaction to take effect

by using the onended callback.

* Remove unnecessary checks that a stream returned by calls to

gDM/gASM are 'live', as that is not the test focus.



Bug: b/272402153

Change-Id: I1b8043ee32444e981653f2f76c7d3d711bd1616c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678723

Reviewed-by: Simon Hangl

Commit-Queue: Elad Alon

entry.title: Revert "[Inspector] Skip adding source data for non-existent implicit nested groups"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 31acf2db4c910a483631f29ed6556af02b93c6c5.



Reason for revert: there is a high chance that this is causing frequent crashes in ToT.



Original change's description:

> [Inspector] Skip adding source data for non-existent implicit nested groups

>

> See the bug for the reproduction and issue description.

>

> The crux of the issue lies in nested group rules[1] and how the parser notifies the observer when they encounter such rules.

>

> Take the CSS below as example:

> ```

> .foo {

> @supports(display: flex) {

> & {

> color: red;

> }

> }

> }

> ```

>

> While parsing the body of the `@supports` rule above, CSS parser notifies the observer that this might be the start of the implicit nested group with a zero length header range[2].

>

> However, if there are no properties for this implicit nested group, CSS parser doesn't register it so such a group doesn't exist for the rule list got from the parser[3].

>

> in this CL, to match the same behavior with the CSS parser while registering the source data, we check whether there are any properties parsed for this possible "implicit nested group".

>

> If not, we skip adding the rule itself and only take its child rules' data.

>

> [1]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting-1/#nested-group-rules

> [2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2122;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

> [3]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2131;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

>

> Fixed: 1445720

> Change-Id: Ifbd2e85873374929d0ceadf4fb5905eaf4ddd62b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4681759

> Reviewed-by: Changhao Han

> Commit-Queue: Changhao Han

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170208}



Change-Id: I6fa289059f07d0d07271b2e216815a90f1cf3daa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687461

Reviewed-by: Alex Rudenko

entry.title: [ios] Force `use_blink = true` for the host toolchain
entry.content:
iOS supports building with or without blink. This is controlled by

setting the variable `use_blink` in args.gn. The default is to not

enable it, but some people move back and forth between enabled and

disabled by editing args.gn and setting `use_blink = false`. This

causes their build to fail because it overrides the default value

for all toolchain, including the host toolchain (macOS), which is

not supported.



Force the variable to true when defining the macOS toolchain as the

host toolchain for an iOS build.



Bug: 1411704

Change-Id: If370281291ab10f6a20458ccb92a6407bb2ef287

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687062

entry.title: Deflake css-set-try-rule-style-text inspector test
entry.content:
See the flaky run here: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac-osxbeta-rel/20119/test-results



As far as I understand, while implementing `@try` rule parsing

we've assumed that it won't be copied like the StyleKeyframeRule. However there is a code path that tries to copy individual try rules.



The issue happens when executing `CSSStyleSheet::WillMutateRules`[1] where it checks whether the stylesheet contents is used from the text cache `IsUsedFromTextCache` and whether it is referenced from a resource `IsReferencedFromResource`.



You can reproduce the failing runs by removing that if block.



For some test runs, the result of this statement change maybe beceause of the specific order of how the tests

are run.



That's why I've attempted to fix this by introducing an explicit `Copy` method from `StyleRuleTry` and removed the assertion that copying this rule won't be reached from the StyleRuleBase's `Copy` method.



[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/css_style_sheet.cc;l=207?q=WillMutateRules



Fixed: 1464926

Change-Id: Ie198b7eb4631911ba3b142c6294b427417b3aa3d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687579

entry.title: [ios][web] Fix //ios/web tests to pass with optimised storage feature
entry.content:
Add an helper method web::test::CreateUnrealizedWebStateWithItems()

to create an unrealized WebState with data loaded from a generated

session storage.



The implementation checks whether the optimised session storage

feature is enabled or not and construct the session using the

correct constructor.



Convert all the tests in ios_web_unittests and ios_web_inttests target

to use the new helper function to create their unrealized WebStates.



Change ErrorPageTest.RestorationFromInvalidURL() to use the Clone()

method to create a clone of a WebState, making it independent of

the value of the feature flag.



Bug: 1383087

Change-Id: Ie7d5008a73293c113a62adcfa753566d43c504bd
